intro: Hieracium chrysomaurum, commonly known as the golden hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded locations. Its flowers are yellow to orange in color, with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets. Hieracium chrysomaurum is often found in temperate climates and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
